archimate:Device.name: Clinical Documentation Mobile Workstation (Computer on Wheels) (COWS)
archimate:Device.documentation:
Intended Use:
• Real-time bedside clinical documentation, accessing EMR/EHR, patient records, medication orders, laboratory and radiology results, patient care coordination, ward rounds.
Specifications:
• Processor Type: o Intel Core i7 or AMD Ryzen 7 (mid-range processor balancing performance, efficiency, and battery life). • Memory Capacity: o Minimum 16 GB RAM (ensures responsive multitasking and clinical applications support). • Storage Capacity: o 512 GB–1 TB SSD (NVMe preferred for fast data access and reliability). • Touch Interface Responsiveness: o High-sensitivity capacitive touchscreen, optimized for clinical use with gloves, stylus, or bare hands o Multi-touch support for intuitive interactions.
• Form Factor and Dimensions: o Compact, slim-line mobile workstation o Height-adjustable for ergonomic use (approx. 40–50 inches adjustable height) o Base footprint: approximately 18–24 inches wide x 18–24 inches deep. • Mobility Features: o Medical-grade, smooth-rolling, lockable caster wheels suitable for easy maneuverability on hospital flooring o Ergonomic handle for comfortable pushing/pulling o Lightweight but durable chassis for ease of use. • Connectivity Options: o Integrated Wi-Fi 6 (ensure compliance with access points) or higher (stable wireless network connectivity) o Bluetooth 5.1 or higher for peripheral connections (barcode scanner, printer, etc.) o Ethernet port for wired network connections o USB-A (minimum 4 ports), USB-C ports, audio jack for peripherals. • Display Size: o 24 inches Full HD (1920x1080) touchscreen (for intuitive interaction with clinical applications) o Anti-glare coating and adjustable viewing angles. • Battery Life: o Integrated battery system providing at least 12 hours continuous runtime o Hot-swappable battery packs for uninterrupted workflow during extended shifts. • Operating System: o Windows 11 Pro (Healthcare-ready configuration, fully compatible with hospital’s EMR/EHR systems).
• Security Features:
o RFID or biometric authentication for secure login/logout o Privacy screen filter integrated or attached. o Remote management and location tracking capability o TPM 2.0 security module for encryption of patient data o Compliant with HIPAA and relevant data security/encryption standards. o Proximity auto-lock (logs out if staff walks away)
• Protective Equipment:
o Medical-grade antimicrobial coating on surfaces o Spill-resistant keyboard and sealed, cleanable surfaces o Protective bumpers for collision prevention and equipment durability.
